thread.title: Actually, Ms. Clinton is right on trade
thread.title_full: Actually, Ms. Clinton is right on trade - The Washington Post

author: washingtonpost.com
title: Actually, Ms. Clinton is right on trade
text:
Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton. (Nati Harnik/Associated Press) October 11 at 6:53 PM The Post’s editorial swipe at former secretary of state Hillary Clinton for being supposedly unprincipled on trade was as predictable as it was wrong [“ So much for principle ,” Oct. 9]. Principled is Ms. Clinton’s campaign focus on closing the wage gap and not supporting a trade agreement that would undermine that focus.
Unprincipled is, after the North American Free Trade Agreement, the World Trade Organization, most-favored-nation status for China and a slew of other trade agreements, not recognizing that the results are ever-widening wage gaps and job losses for Americans.
To agree to the Trans-Pacific Partnership in the face of these overwhelming outcomes would truly be unprincipled.
Leslie Byrne , Falls Church
